Getting started

M-down is a command line tool which helps you to create documentations, descriptions, teaching materials using extendable markdown language.

Let's quickly go through the example below to get the idea, how can you use M-down.

Prerequest

M-down is written in NodeJS. Make sure to install it before you proceed.

Hello World!

Create an empty folder in your computer and open up a command line or bash.

1. Create a new folder called pages where you will store the content for your site. 

mkdir pages

2. Install m-down. 

npm -g install m-down

3. Create your hello world page. 

echo # Hello World! > pages/hello.md

4. Configure the menu. 

echo [{ "link": "/hello", "name": "Hello World" }] > menu.json

5. And generate your site! 

m-down

Congratulation!

Now you can serve your content to the public via GitHub Pages or just try it locally using the static-server npm package. 

npm -g install static-server 
cd dist/

static-server -p 8080

And you did it! Here you go! :)
